meanings.definition: Presenting or explaining (something) in a different way.
meanings.sent1: She is reframing the story to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys reframing old photographs to give them a new look.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about reframing a boring lecture as an action movie.
meanings.sent4: In her painting, she is reframing reality into a dreamlike scene.
meanings.sent5: By reframing the problem, he found a creative solution.

meanings.definition: Changing the context or perspective of (something).
meanings.sent1: They are reframing the issue to consider all viewpoints.
meanings.sent2: Reframing the situation helped her see it from a different angle.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended they were reframing the classroom as a spaceship.
meanings.sent4: His speech reframed the debate, shifting the focus to a new aspect.
meanings.sent5: Through reframing, she transformed a challenge into an opportunity.

meanings.definition: Adjusting or altering the frame or structure of (something).
meanings.sent1: The carpenter is reframing the doorway to fit a larger door.
meanings.sent2: Reframing the picture required changing the size of the frame.
meanings.sent3: He humorously suggested reframing the house to fit a giant couch.
meanings.sent4: The architect reframed the building design to enhance its aesthetics.
meanings.sent5: By reframing the puzzle, he was able to see the solution clearly.
